result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis L Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*60 day jail sentence to the Portage County Jail
*Zero days of jail credit
*Eligible for huber work and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
*Defendant may petition the Court for early release, not earlier than June 2023 and if the agent is in agreement

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

*No contact with F.B., F.B., Jr., or J.H.
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
*No contact with the co-defendants:  Dominick Hi and Michael Wilson

*Maintain absolute sobriety 
*Participate in any counseling, treatment or assessments as deemed appropriate by the agent and comply with any recommendations
*Submit DNA sample

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis L Garcia

records.addlTxt: Notice of Expiration of State Public Defender Appointment filed by Atty Jeanne Zamzow

AMENDED Count 1:  Impose but STAYED Jail Sentence and Placed on Probation
Count 2:  Dismissed and Read In
Portage County DNA Proof of Submission
filed by Atty Jeanne Zamzow
filed by Atty Jeanne Zamzow

11:34 AM Defendant Curtis L Garcia in court.  Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court for Curtis L Garcia.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls the case.
ADA Pfeil states the appearances.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
State is in compliance with victim rights notification.
ADA Pfeil indicates that Count 1 will be amended to disorderly conduct.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
AMENDED Count 1 - Guilty 
Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of AMENDED Count 1: Disorderly Conduct 947.01.
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
Dismissed and Read In:  Count 2

ADA Pfeil makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.
Atty Zamzow makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Court questions ADA Pfeil if he is motioning the Court to amend Count 1 and he is.

BY THE COURT: 
AMENDED Count 1:
Impose but STAY a 60 day jail sentence to the Portage County Jail
Zero days of jail credit
Eligible for huber work and any other reason the Sheriff will allow
Placed on Probation for a Period of 12 Months -
Conditions of Probation:
Defendant may petition the Court for early release, not earlier than June 2023 and if the agent is in agreement
No contact with F.B., F.B., Jr., or J.H.
Maintain absolute sobriety 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
No contact with the co-defendants:  Dominick Hi and Michael Wilson
Participate in any counseling, treatment or assessments as deemed appropriate by the agent and comply with any recommendations
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Submit DNA sample

Defendant Record Update

Matter set for a PTC on 06/20/2022 at 8:45 a.m. -  Defendant was referred for a disorderly conduct charge several months ago. The offer was revised to address this currently uncharged referral. Another pretrial is needed to finalize global resolution.
Pre-trial conference on June 20, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Defendant Record Update
Matter set for a PTC on 5/16/22 at 8:45 a.m.
Pre-trial conference on May 16, 2022 at 08:45 am.

01:43 PM Defendant Curtis L Garcia in court with Attorney (Atty) Taylor O Soule. Defendant Curtis L Garcia in custody. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Curtis L Garcia appeared by video at the Portage County Jail.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
filed by Atty Taylor Soule

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Taylor Soule
Initial Appearance set for January 31, 2022 @ 1:30 p.m. in Br 1

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol
No contact with Michael Wilson

1:36 p.m.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of 2 Counts of Disorderly Conduct and 2 Counts of Misdemeanor Battery.
PBT .174
Atty Soule  does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $500 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond. 
Court adopts the $500 signature bond as requested by the State with conditions as stated on the record. 

Initial Appearance scheduled for:  January 31, 2022  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
